titles.title: Healthy Businesses, Healthy Workers Reinsurance Act of 2009
A bill to amend the Social Security Act to establish a Federal Reinsurance Program for Catastrophic Health Care Costs.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S84)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services

bill.summary:
1/6/2009--Introduced.
Healthy Businesses, Healthy Workers Reinsurance Act of 2009 - Amends the Social Security Act to add a new title XXII (Federal Reinsurance Program for Catastrophic Health Care Costs). Establishes within the Department of Health and Human Services an Office of Federal Reinsurance, which shall in turn establish a Federal Reinsurance Program for Catastrophic Health Care Costs to make reinsurance payments to eligible health plans experiencing catastrophic health care costs during a year with respect to a covered individual. Establishes in the Treasury the Federal Reinsurance for Catastrophic Health Care Costs Trust Fund.
